review: It's a great streaming device and I love it's compatibility with all things Apple. We own an iMac, MacBook, 2 iPads and 2 iPhones, so it was a natural choice. The mirroring function is fun and easy, and I love that it syncs with my iCloud photos. We use the photos as the screensaver. The only issue I have is that it doesn't play Amazon Prime videos. Sad Face. But we just play them on our iPad and mirror them to the TV. Problem solved.

review: I finally purchased the Apple TV. We love it! We got rid of my cable TV due the fact that we rarely watch shows when they actually aired. We DVRed every episode. We dropped cable and went with Netflix and Hulu Plus. We went through FPU and we are now saving lots of money by getting rid of our cable. Being able to access iTunes and also mirroring from my iPad and laptop are really great features. We Love our AppleTV and We would highly recommend to anyone!

review: I bought an Apple TV when there were fewer options on the market for a streaming device (no Chromecast, no Amazon box, fewer Rokus) and since then it has been utterly eclipsed in functionality, reliability and price. Many of the functions require you to be using ONLY Apple products, and NEWER Apple products. My 2009 Macbook Pro (with updated software) cannot mirror screens to the Apple TV. But that is far from the worst of it.Apple TV will not allow you to install newer Apps, so there is no Amazon Instant Video, no internet browser or any other useful apps. You can stream from your iOS device, but it is slow. The remote app for iPad or iPhone seems like something that was made in an afternoon and then forgot about for years. Useless.My top issue with the Apple TV is reliability. Almost half the times I try to stream Netflix I get errors or the connection drops out. Buy a Roku. Or a Chromecast. Apple TV is an outdated, forgotten product.

review: I have several ways of watching videos including SageTV, MCE, Roku, Ceton, and AppleTV.  I like the Netflix application on the Roku better than what is installed on the Apple TV (it automatically goes to the next show in the series).  HBO Go seems to be about the same.  But, neither device supports Cinemax Go so I have to stream that from my iPhone.  And that is where the Roku cannot compare to the Apple TV.  Airplay is a great service supported by the AppleTV that lets you stream video from your iPhone/iPad to your TV.  The quality is great.  I also use AirPlay to watch ShoAnytime.  The price is practically impulse buy, but the rumor is that Apple will release a newer, more powerful version soon that might include apps.
